I200402190800

java version "1.5.0-beta"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0-beta-b32c)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0-beta-b32c, mixed mode)

I was happily working away on eclipse when out of the blue it disappeared. I 
thought it might be a hard crash but there was no dump file created or a dialog 
box saying so. After a few second a popup showed saying couldn't start eclipse 
check your .log file:
here are the last few errors:

The failure to create the first image (the NoMoreHandles exception at the 
bottom of the trace) is the cause of the exceptions that follow.  
Image.java:1583 is trying to allocate an image, so the error message is 
accurate.

There isn't anything for swt to do here, because it only creates/destroys 
system resources as instructed by the eclipse layers above.  There are a few 
known eclipse leaks that still haven't been fixed, but it's also possible that 
the new look desktop has introduced new leaks.

I'll do a quick check with Sleak, and then close this report when finished.  I 
just did this < 2 months ago though (bug 49471), so I'm only going to focus on 
new-look components.
Found one new one (bug 53822).  Still looking...
It looks like others above swt are already doing this analysis (stumbled onto 
recent bug 53473 and bug 52856).

To search for all Platform bugs with "leak" in the summary:

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/buglist.cgi?

llwordssubstr&long_desc=&bug_file_loc_type=allwordssubstr&bug_file_loc=&keywords
_type=allwords&keywords=&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=REOPENED&
emailtype1=substring&email1=&emailtype2=substring&email2=&bugidtype=include&bug_
id=&votes=&changedin=&chfieldfrom=&chfieldto=Now&chfieldvalue=&cmdtype=doit&name
dcmd=all+swt&newqueryname=&order=Reuse+same+sort+as+last+time&field0-0-
0=noop&type0-0-0=noop&value0-0-0=

Closing this report.
